Mankulakārāma：A monastery in Sunāparanta wherePunna Thera lived and where the Buddha visited him．

Near by was a village of merchants where Punna went for his alms and where lived his brother Culla Punna．After the merchants had been saved from death by the intervention of Punna，they gave him a share of the red sandalwood they had obtained in the course of their travels，and with this they built a mandalamāla in the vihāra and dedicated it to the Buddha．The Buddha lived there for seven days．

SA．iii．15ff．
